website_summaries.verdict: If you want a jig system but don't need a large set or simply want numerous tools for a reasonable price, this handy option is both practical for most jobs and value-priced for most budgets.
pros: Its drill guide, multi-purpose clamp, and vacuum dust shroud bring efficiency to countless woodworking jobs
Owners find it easy to use – even those who are woodworking novices
cons: The drill bit is a bit weak, especially for tough jobs

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for cabinets/bookshelves
customer_reviews.text: I've been renovating for 20 years, and have always constructed shelving with a routed joint--bullet proof construction, but very time consuming. This Kreg jig is a fantastic time saver, and makes replicating a breeze--if you needed 4 cabinets the exact size for instance. I am a HUGE fan- makes joinery a breeze. I also highly recommend the Kreg clamp- it's fast become my go-to--automatically adjusts to thickness--another must-have tool!
customer_reviews.author: Mariann Yeager

customer_reviews.title: Drill bit is crooked.
customer_reviews.text: This product surely is genius and it's not the first one I owned. But the reason for two stars is the quality assurance is poor. My drill bit fresh out of the paper sleeve is not straight. The hex part is crooked, renders it impossible to use, it is wobbly. (See attached image) Thankfully Amazon's one day replacement policy saved me time, only delayed work for a day.
customer_reviews.author: Julian L.

customer_reviews.title: A whole new world of furniture building!
customer_reviews.text: This system has opened up a whole new world of furniture making for me. I don't have the space of finances to indulge in a full-size workshop, and this system does so much for me insofar as joinery is concerned. I attached a few of the many projects I've built as a result of owning this jig: cabinets for my stealth camper van, and a media console for my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great System, Cheap and Weak Drill Bit
customer_reviews.text: Great system. I've used this for a few projects now and it has been a super product four quick joinery. The cheap bit was a disappointment however. It broke and even a replacement shattered as well. I've been very careful about drilling properly but yet it seems the tip is very fragile. I'd suggest buying an extra bit just in case. Kreg needs to improve the bit strength!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Cabinets and Furniture!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought and used this for the first time to build custom cabinets and to furnish the inside of a camper. Worked Amazing! Probably saved hundreds from not having to buy brackets! So much faster than any method I know of using wooden dowels! This is by far, one of the easiest and cheapest ways to put together two pieces of wood, that I know of!
customer_reviews.author: William Docter

customer_reviews.title: Functional black magic at a great value
customer_reviews.text: Can I just say how much I love this jig? I'm relatively new to woodworking and if I didn't know any better, I'd say that using pocket holes to assemble projects is black magic. As long as you set the thickness properly on the jig and the drill bit collar, it will come out perfectly every time. I'd recommend watching a couple tutorial videos before you get started, just to make sure you've got it down correctly. It's also extremely satisfying to use. Makes me feel like a surgeon. Highly recommended, and well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Davidson M Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Wish I'd bought this a few years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I've eyed this item for years, and always balked at the high price. It never seems to go on sale anywhere, and so the years have passed. I finally broke down and bought one, and I've already used it a bunch of times. It's very well thought out, which is clear once you start using it. Just the little things. However, if you look at (cheaper) competition, you might not understand why this is a little more expensive. Little things like the little guide for setting up the depth collar on the drill bit (which is also provided). The removable drill guide, so that you can use it on already-assembled work (without the entire jig). Well recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Quilpole

customer_reviews.title: Quality Issues Cause Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: The bad item was replaced.. love it now. Got my K4 today and was all ready to start joining pieces to my project. But the index marks on the side of the drill guide were gone. Well, not actually gone, but so faint that I couldn't make out a single value. Anyway, quite disappointing, but hopefully it was just a bad run. I've returned it for a replacement. I will report back when I get it and see if it has the same problem. See the attached images and note that this is with a zoomed in picture and a flash... still barely legible.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Quick but dents the wood
customer_reviews.text: It's MUCH easier to use than the smaller versions I have, that's for sure. Quick setup with great pocket holes. The issue I'm having is the jig is marring the wood, hard or soft, no matter how lightly I adjust the clamp. I'm not sure if I have a defective unit but I can't seem to get around it. I'm also not sure what vacuum is meant to fit the dust port. I have multiple adapters but none are quite right. I'm able to use one hand on the drill and another holding the hose but it's not ideal.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Buboltz

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: Spent $150 on the product and it came with missing pieces. Would like to speak with dealer to get missing pieces. Highly unsatisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Must have when woodworking
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Kreg now several times to make a desk, cornhole boards and other projects. Easy to use and directions are easy. I did end up buying a clamp, this kit didn't come with one. It did come with a sample of screws and plugs that was nice. I am trying to find a substitute for the Kreg screws since I think they are a little pricey. Overall, so glad I bought it even though I thought it was pricey at the time. Works great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Segal

customer_reviews.title: Yeppers
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about Kreg's that's not said already. Kreg has the best products on the market. There are times when buying a 'cheeper' brand may be ok, but not when it comes to the quality of Kreg. My only problem is some of their stuff can just make your life easier, but the price is so high that trying to justify buying them is hard to get over. I wish I had more money so I could through caution in the wind and have a whole workshop of Kreg stuff, like that luck dude in their videos.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Baze

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recomend it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, I can't believe I have it owned one of these sooner. I built this table in a very little amount of time with it. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: christopher peck

customer_reviews.title: Missing part
customer_reviews.text: The set screw for the stop collar which is item “H” in the owner’s manual is missing. I can’t properly use the bit as a result. I have been using electrical tape on the bit as a stop, that’s not acceptable for a $99 item I’m being short changed on a screw, how much does that save you? The only reason I didn’t send this thing back is because I already got rid of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: pocket hole System verses screws and nails
customer_reviews.text: I Bought the Kreg Jig k4 pocket hole system to make Cornhole game boards with to avoid having nail or screw holes to fill in and ruin the finish by having the filled holes sink in after the paint dried the pocket hole system works great all the screws are hidden and the frames are more square and are stronger than they would be if they were screwed together from the outside. I would recommend the Kreg Jig k4 Pocket Hole System to anyone who wants a professional outcome on any project where the pocket hole system can be used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If You're a Beginner, You Need This
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool. I was able to build my router table frame in about 30 minutes with this tool. I just cut my four legs, 4 supports, and the 4 pieces to provide a base for my router table, and then just drilled the pocket screw holes and screwed them all together. Went like a dream. Good idea to get an Automax Clamp though. I liked it a lot and its an easy tool to use. Pretty much everything Kreg makes I love, even if it is more expensive. It saves me time, and keeps me from getting burned out on projects, so it pays for itself in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Hill

customer_reviews.title: Drill stop doesnt hold.
customer_reviews.text: I like this Kreg pocket hole system. It makes joining wood easy and the joints are nice and tight. I have a complaint regarding the stop on the drill bit. It doesn't hold the position it was tightened to. "I only had this two months. This is very annoying. In the middle of drilling a pocket hole the stop slips down the bit. Cant tighten it enough to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J. vitale

customer_reviews.title: More useful than I expected it to be
customer_reviews.text: This tool initially struck me as overpriced and unnecessary, but I was convinced to buy it after reading about it in a few woodworking blogs and tutorials. It's wound up being an indispensable tool that I've used more often than I expected. It's handiness comes from being extremely good at what it's used for -- providing a way to drill holes so that you can join two pieces of wood together side by side. It wound up being something I reach for in many of the projects I work on.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have seen this for a long time, but didn't know how much difference ut might make in my projects. It is made of high quality materials and very easy to master. Putting my first cabinet was much easier using no dado cuts, and not having to balance and band/clamp eveything. A few tips to make it easier to use: - start with farthest right holevso thw torque doesnt try to spin the board - provide a secure surface behind the joint to keep the edges aligned - when drilling holes on wide boards provide a 1 inch high prop to keep the board level in the jig
customer_reviews.author: T. Gentry

customer_reviews.title: K5 is more ergonomic for production work
customer_reviews.text: Works really well, after using it to build several cabinets I realized that the K5 jig puts the clamp handle in front of the jig which is way more ergonomic. If I had realized that ahead of time I would have spent the extra cash on the K5.
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Pruente

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: My woodworking skills are very limited. Read the other reviews for more intelligent information. I have had it two days and I made an end table!
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Kreg Pocket Hole Jig System
customer_reviews.text: This item is well worth the money if you are a wood worker who uses pocket screws. It saves you time and lets you be hands off the wood, while you are drilling. I bought it for my roommate and he LOVES it!
customer_reviews.author: RoseyR77

customer_reviews.title: Missing drill bit
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived without drill bit included making it worthless out of the gate. My remedy required a call to the manufacturer and was only able to leave a phone message. I'll readjust my rating based on my outcome. This may be an Amazon oversight as the item was purchased from their Warehouse product line. Updated: 10.12.20--Kreg Co. came through and provided a replacement drill bit without fanfare. I will assume the product is at the least very good, as the company has stood behind this purchase, and will update it one more star if when I get a chance to use it, it really impresses.
customer_reviews.author: cal

customer_reviews.title: Great product, cheap drill bit
customer_reviews.text: The jig is great and hundreds of reviews echo this sentiment. The drill bit sucks and the blue Kote screws I ordered don’t work so great. Square drive is a very smart design but the drill bit is soft and balds quickly. From what I can tell the blueKote has too much Kote. This doesn’t allow for full engagement of the drill bit and screw. When driving, the bit will slip way too easily. Feels like working with a cheap Phillips head. Kinda don’t know what to do now. I may choose another form of joinery. Can’t trust this as the ‘staple’ I was looking forward to...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect addition
customer_reviews.text: I used the smaller one for almost a year and I am so glad I upgraded. This makes my project builds so much faster. I like that the backside has metal and not plastic like the smaller one. I can’t wait to start building cabinets for our full length wall desk.
customer_reviews.author: Jsdavidson0407

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool, where has it been all this time.
customer_reviews.text: When you want to hide the fasteners, this tool makes slick work of it. The joints are tight, clean and easy to reproduce. I made a few sets of Cornhole boards and used this tool to hide all the screws. Just about as easy as a nail gun but a lot cleaner looking job. Most important thing is setting the torque right on the screw driver when adding the screws. Faster than a bisque joiner. Highly recommend this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Knolls

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boyfriend's birthday. He loves it. That's good enough for me. If it helps anyone, he is very picky.
customer_reviews.author: Cupcake's R2D2

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: I've seen many counterfeit ones in the market but there's a reason why this cost this much. The overall build quality is sturdy and the cut/ drilling is accurate. Adjust the height and depth in accord with your board width and you'll get perfect pocket holes every time!
customer_reviews.author: Eryck H.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool to have
customer_reviews.text: Kreg has really out done themselves with this easy to use tool. I’ve been looking for patio furniture but I refuse to pay the outlandish prices they are asking. So I’ve decided to build my own. Almost finished and the kreg tools made it look professionally done.
customer_reviews.author: C.H.

customer_reviews.title: You can't go wrong with a Kreg
customer_reviews.text: This system is amazing! Where has it been all my life? I put together a workbench project yesterday in a VERY short time, thanks to the ease of drilling pocket holes and using the Keg screws. If you're looking at the options between the Kreg jigs, and you have a shop-vac, do yourself a favor by getting a kit that comes with the shop-vac attachment. I drilled a *lot* of holes yesterday, and I made very little mess by using the shop-vac while drilling. You can't go wrong with a Kreg system, if you do any sort of cabinetry or other woodworking. I plan on using this a lot!
customer_reviews.author: coryalex

customer_reviews.title: This may just be may favorite tool in my entire shop
customer_reviews.text: This may just be may favorite tool in my entire shop. If you don't know me, consider yourself lucky because you would probably get sick of me mentioning how great this is. I know a lot of people who buy these don't take the time to learn how to use it. But a quick couple minute read of the manual explains exactly how to set up the drill bit for proper hole depth based on the wood you are using.
customer_reviews.author: adam laatsch

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than it works as expected and I would recommend any combination that includes a Kreg pocket hole. I wish I got the kit that had a clamp included to hold this down and in place as the clamp I am using is one I have and it is too fat and long to fit in where it is needed. For now, i screwed it to a piece of wood and then clamp the wood to my workbench but think I will get the clamp to make it easier to store and move around.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin P Overholt

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust the width to fit the board or stud
customer_reviews.text: The design is limited to fit different thickness, and very difficult to adjust the width.
customer_reviews.author: T. CHEN

customer_reviews.title: Quick and efficient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Kreg Jr. that I thought just took too long to position every time. After my first couple uses I don't think I will go back unless I have to. It is way quicker to just move the board in this setup than to have to reposition the Jr. everytime. If you are looking between this and the Jr. I would definitely go with this if you are planning on make a lot of holes on a board. Adjusting the clamp is kind of a pain but if you are using all the same size boards it makes pretty quick work of it.
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Not what was pictured.
customer_reviews.text: Item pictured as well as description shows all guides in inches. Even the box it came in pictures show inches. However, the jig itself had metric guides in millimeters.
customer_reviews.author: JayArDee

customer_reviews.title: Works great on shorter boards
customer_reviews.text: I've had the small portable R3 pocket hole jig for years - always worked great. The K4 is different in that you bring the work to it, rather than taking the jig to the work. So consider the size of the material as it will have to sit on top of this little machine while you clamp it in place. Great for smaller cabinet rails, probably not suitable for longer items as they would be harder to clamp and keep square.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Mullally

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe it took me so long to get one of these. Great.
customer_reviews.text: As a fairly proficient home Carpenter and home improvement guy I can't believe I went so long without having one of these. I've used it far more than I ever thought I would and I'm very impressed with the quality both of the product itself and of the joints it creates.
customer_reviews.author: KC Jones

customer_reviews.title: working great, but received used
customer_reviews.text: upgraded from the cheaper pocket hole jig. This works much better and more secure. Product looked used, but maybe only once and not enough to warrant a return - still worked as expected
customer_reviews.author: stvo

customer_reviews.title: Handy Tool!
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for one of my sons. He had borrowed a friend’s and decided he wanted one of his own. After watching him work with it I would say it is easy to use and adjust. He has built a desk and a trash and recycling “box” for their kitchen, so he has used it quite a bit. A barn door for their utility room is next and a quilt ladder for me. Handy tool!
customer_reviews.author: Jane Bach

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool for simpler joinery
customer_reviews.text: Got this jig because I didn't have the equipment to make more traditional joinery (i.e. mortise and tenon, dovetail, rabbets). It works really well. Please know that if you don't replace the long drill bit with a standard long phillips bit, you will be forced to continue buying the proprietary Kreg square head screws. The first thing I did was go to Menards and get a really long phillips bit and now I can use regular bulk purchased screws for my projects. Also, adding a little glue to each joint is a must! Softwoods like pine will not keep a tight join just with the screws. I learned that the hard way.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Newberry

customer_reviews.title: Broke Easily
customer_reviews.text: The drill bit caught the metal cylinder you have to drill through and broke off sticking to the drill bit a the tool was not possible to be used after 15 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The famous Kreg Jig doesn't dissappoint
customer_reviews.text: Everyone knows how great these tools are and for the price, they probably should be. But truly, this tool will save you hundreds of hours building any kind of jointed project. Cabinets, beds, frames, benches, the list goes on and on. It's strong, consistent, and the vacuum attachment saves on the mess. Even a novice DIY should have one.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Tobin

customer_reviews.title: Makes "rough" joining much easier.
customer_reviews.text: It works really work for its purpose. It won't replace dovetails for "nice" furniture, but for quickly and squarely joining wood, its really nice. My only complaint is that its not great with 1/2" wood, and it doesn't look like the 3/4" coarse screws that would best with non-hardwood and MDF are made anymore, so the screws alone won't hold. Still worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gorilla Monsoon

customer_reviews.title: Professional look
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and gives wood working projects that professional look. I use it all the time. You need this if you want your projects to look good. I first used it for a dog gate with a cat opening on the side.
customer_reviews.author: amac

customer_reviews.title: The Jig Is Up
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Jig to make a porch swing. Worth every cent. I am a novice when it comes to wood working. This made me look like an apprentice with a year of experience on This Old House.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E. McCue

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough good about this tool. It does a great job. I used it to build the frames for my barn doors. I can't wait to use it on more projects.
customer_reviews.author: Craftee Lady

customer_reviews.title: can't live without it
customer_reviews.text: it takes a few trials to understand and get things aligned but once you do - it becomes an indispensable tool. I highly recommend watching a few youtube videos - I found using this pocket hole system with various clamps gets the job done easily.
customer_reviews.author: Henriquez Family

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra money to buy this one!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product a six I would. I have been using the small Kreg pocket hole jig for some time and really like it. This takes the process to a whole new level. Since you are moving the board and not the jig changing from one end (or side) of the board is quick and simple. My guess is I can finish drilling all of my pocket holes in less than one half the time it took with the little jig (which is still a great product and I am sure there will times I will need it). The vacuum attachment works great, zero chips or sawdust escape through it. Well worth the extra expense.
customer_reviews.author: PhilCO48

customer_reviews.title: Good jig
customer_reviews.text: Great jig. Makes pocket holes easy. Only issue was the set screw for the drill depth went flying after my third hole. Never found it. Should have a better locking set screw.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but a few problems
customer_reviews.text: I had a single hole Kreg Jig and liked the idea, so upgraded for a chest of drawers project. Even though I followed directions for depth and screw length I had some trouble with tips of screws popping through. At that point I tried everything first on scrap wood. Ended up using non-Kreg screws and had better results. I like the concept and when it works, it works very, very well. However, I would recommend trying every joint on scrap wood pieces to make sure you get the right depth. I don't have much room in my garage, so I would not be able to build some of the things I have without the pocket hole jig.
customer_reviews.author: Bocca

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant invention
customer_reviews.text: Genius. This set makes it a cinch to make joins for building bookcases, or niche shelves, or cabinet making. A brilliant system that produces a solid, strong connection, and a beautiful, clean finish. Everything you would need to get started is included in this package: screw bit, drill bit, the jig, a few sample screws, and the vacuum tube attachment. I cannot recommend this enough. It's worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Hugh K.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use, solid joints
customer_reviews.text: Very new to pocket holes, but I love this purchase. Built a table for a new projector I just bought and was able to make the joints in a matter of minutes. You’ll need to buy a pack of Kreg screws because this only comes with a few. I will certainly be buying the smaller version, as this one would be very challenging to drill into MDF or plywood.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for making drawers 2x4 work.
customer_reviews.text: Great little item if you do alot of woodworking. quick and strong joints with just a few minutes of time. opens to about 3 inches wide so no 4x4 joinery or 2x4 flat. great for 2x4 or small boards. quick easy box making tool. comes a with some screws but you will need more if you want to use it for more than just a few projects. simple to use. good instructions on Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Highspeedplay

customer_reviews.title: Good price and great value on pocket hole tooling with the Kreg system
customer_reviews.text: I like that the K4 master set has all you need to begin making pocket holes. Good support information and instructional videos are available on-line.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Giboney

customer_reviews.title: This is a must if your in to building things.
customer_reviews.text: I have had the jig for several months now and I do really like how easy it is to use. when you first get the jig you need to ensure that you have everything adjusted properly or you will send the drill bit through the bottom of the holder. The holder is easy to adjust with its locking screw but you need to ensure that the screw is snug because it can become a little loose if your not paying attention to it. I have made a couple pieces with the use of a saw, the jig, and lots of wood/screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try building my first piece of furniture and this was recommended. Made the job much easier and gave it that professional look. Easy to use right out of the box. Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: spiderj

customer_reviews.title: nifty gadget
customer_reviews.text: This system is a great way to join wood together. It does what it says it does well and has everything you need to get started. I recommend the five size screw kit with it and bought the right angle and face clamps also which I don't regret. You need to be careful when you are screwing close to the edge in end grain as it can split the wood. The jig is 1" tall so out feed support is a little awkward because you can't just slide a 3/4' board on the side to support long pieces. I built a box to mount it on/in to provide the outfeed support and not need a clamp to hold the jig.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hutchinson

customer_reviews.title: dust collector?
customer_reviews.text: nice jig for sure. easy to use. my one complaint has to do with the dust collector attachment. it wont fit my shop vac or any shop vac i have ever owned and ive gone through a fair number of them over the years.
customer_reviews.author: william c freeh

customer_reviews.title: What a difference this thing makes!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference this jig makes. I’ve always used the smaller, cheaper Kreg Jig. This newer model is just great. Much easier and more efficient to use because of the clamping system. More accurate drilling. And the dust port works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the novice
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I am a novice builder, and this has helped me tremendously so far. While there are long held techniques meant to hide the methods of joining lumber they are far more advanced and less user friendly for the novice on a budget. I practiced a couple time on scrap lumber before my actual builds to get the hang of it. In the end, I found the set-up to be super easy and the implementation even easier. You don't necessarily have to mount this for it to work well, but it is highly recommended just to make it that much easier.
customer_reviews.author: C.J.

customer_reviews.title: By far my favorite tool you will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I waited and waited before buying this. By far my favorite tool you will not be disappointed. Couple tips, use the drill stop when creating pockets and turn your drill to about a 5 for the stop otherwise you will go right through. not a product flaw it was user error.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AAA
customer_reviews.text: Still learning the ins and outs of this product. Likely better for people who do a lot of drawer or cabinet making.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Connected
customer_reviews.text: I thought it would on my shelf for a while. But within a few minutes I found myself using it numerous times. Better than the alternative method.
customer_reviews.author: F. Garbutt

customer_reviews.title: Great Product/ Awesome Warranty
customer_reviews.text: Great product easy to use. Had used it for multiple DIY projects with good results. Unfortunately the black clamping part broke, but the AWESOME WARRANTY replaced it right away. Great Customer Service on Kregs Behalf.
customer_reviews.author: Gilberto Quinones

customer_reviews.title: Great for construction/building
customer_reviews.text: Saved so much time with this pre-drilling holes. Was able to build a bed, and two tables using this. Easy to use. Would recommend to builders of any skill set
customer_reviews.author: KMorris

customer_reviews.title: Bad ass!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing. I recently started building cornhole boards and this makes life so much simpler. AND It makes the boards so seamless with all the screws hidden under the board.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Great jig
customer_reviews.text: Had a little bit of a burr on one of the holes, but otherwise works great! Very easy to make accurate joints.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Better projects with this tool!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve looked at these jigs for a while and never wanted to spend the money. I’ve built many things in our home without the use of one of these but now that I have it, I want to start over on every project. These take your home projects to a whole new level. Clean, easy to use, quick set up and rock solid joints. Pictures to come once I’m finished with current projects. If you’re even considering buying this.....do it. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Hensley

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought this a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: I have used biscuit joints in the past to make cabinet face frames. I would spend a week with biscuits, glue and clamps getting a kit when complete. With this jig I had them built and attached in a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mehhh

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great tool, just wished they were a little more reasonably priced for being plastic, but looks well enough built that it will hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Vacationer

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a pocket hole jig, and finally ran into some extra funds, and bit the bullet. This jig is very nice, and I will recommend it every time now that I have one. Anywhere there is a joint to be attached, this jig does it quicker, and nicer than any other system or idea I have used. The pocket holes really make things have the appearance of built by a pro. I am currently making some cabinet extensions for my kitchen, and they are much sturdier than the original cabinets that were in the house. Highly recommend this tool for anyone that is into carpentry work.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: ... a kitchen table using this jig and it worked great.
customer_reviews.text: I made a kitchen table using this jig and it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Bud

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this product. It works as advertised. You have to be careful not to overdrive the screws. Use a light setting with a screw driver or drill. It is easy to correctly position the guide. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm and this was the best price we could find. Used it to put together a table and chairs. Only one I have used but so far it has been great. Easy to use and understand. I bought some more screws at Home Depot. They actually have a Kreg Jig section - you can buy these screws in the normal hardware section.
customer_reviews.author: Edson Scott Gilmore

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little thing! I am a woman with zero wood working knowledge that used this to build a patio couch. Honestly, this was the easiest part of building it... ha! I would definitely recommend and use again!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin C.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item to add to your shop of tools
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item to add to your shop of tools. I used the jig to build my storage cabinet. I constructed the box out of 3/4 in birch plywood and made a top and face frame with africian mahogany. I used pocket joints on everything even the face frame. I have been doing woodworking for many years (40 plus) and never knew how pocket joinery could be so easy and make projects look great. I would recommend viewing the dvd that comes with the jig before starting a project. This product is great!
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Bynum

customer_reviews.title: Yup
customer_reviews.text: This is the top end before you get into one of the expensive machines. Being able to dial in a width is a nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: James C

customer_reviews.title: Kreg kit
customer_reviews.text: I have noticed wooden tables that were constructed in this fashion. Some of these tables were made in the 1950's or even before that. My point is that this is not a new idea, it is just a small portable tool so that the average person like me can do it at home. With good square cuts and glue, this tool allows you to run screws in at an angle. These screws stay tight and add the durability needed to stand up to some rough use. This tool eliminates the need to clamp, so it's a real time saver. I have used this tool several times. Hope this information helps.
customer_reviews.author: RSL1

customer_reviews.title: Pro quality results for the passionate rookie..
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit over 4 years ago and used it on several projects and never once regretted the purchase. I am not a professional wood worker by any means but it is every bit as easy to use as the original infomercial showed when it caught my attention. It even comes with a demonstration cd that I usually watch before using the jig to refresh my memory. My projects always turn out much better since using this tool and I definitely recommend it to any home owner with an interest in wood working projects...
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Looking for more opportunities to use it
customer_reviews.text: If you have never used one before, you will start looking for other projects to use it on. The only drawback is that I now have to plan out my screw pattern and assembly steps much more carefully now.
customer_reviews.author: Piper

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful tool that takes very little talent / skill / ...
customer_reviews.text: Amateur who recently got into working with wood. Wonderful tool that takes very little talent / skill / practice to use safely / properly. If you can do VERY simply arithmetic, know how to use a power drill, and understand the concept of "righty tighty / lefty lucy" you'll enjoy this item.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Parker

customer_reviews.title: Useful tool
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I love this tool! We used it to build make pocketholes on a toddler stool and a farmhouse dining room table from plans on ana-white.com. I used it on a few test pieces to make sure I was doing it correctly, and the first few I didn't so I definitely recommend testing it on scrap wood first. It is really easy to use now that I got the hang of it. Great for joining a table top so no screws show. We have become addicted to woodworking now that we have this tool.
customer_reviews.author: J Mumford

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for every woodworker
customer_reviews.text: Being a woodworker most of my life, I resisted getting one of these because it seemed like cheating. I always did a lap joint or mortise and tenon because that is `real woodworking`. I finally broke down and bought one and wish I had years earlier. Joints are very strong yet so much faster than any other method. I found I use it for far more than just face frames too.
customer_reviews.author: William E.

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient, built to last.
customer_reviews.text: Bought here and then found the exact same item for $20 at a garage sale, so I returned the Amazon one. This thing is great for quick and simple construction. It's easy to use once you read the instructions on how to adjust it. You have to buy their self tapping square drive screws, but they are worth it for the convenience of this jig. Good for new projects and for repairs. Would recommend for small to medium projects. They have an HD version for material larger than a 1.5".
customer_reviews.author: Michael N

customer_reviews.title: Pocket Hole Jig
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product. If you have ever tried to drill a pocket hole without a jig you will really appreciate this. I balked at the price at first but knew I would be getting a lot of use out of it right off. I am making kitchen cabinets and this jig works GREAT. I love the simplicity and all of the hype about how easy it is to use is solid. With a small amount of working skill you should be able to use this no problem. Even in the first days of beginning wood working shop I think this would have seemed elemementary. Great design and well engineered. What else needs to be said?
customer_reviews.author: RobbT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: The system helped me get into pocket hole joinery. Nice instructions, though I also found internet video's by kreg helpful too.
customer_reviews.author: TG

customer_reviews.title: A Woodworkers must have.
customer_reviews.text: I previously owned a Pocket Hole Jig I purchased 15 years ago that was recommended by Wood Magazine. Should have bought the Kreg. This is definitely the best and I'll use my old one for a paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, Kreg makes the best pocket hole jigs on the market. Just upgraded to the K4 and love it. Simple to use, accurate, and a huge time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Huthfam

customer_reviews.title: Great little jig
customer_reviews.text: Great jig. My main complaint is the indicator marks for the holes on the jig get covered when using 3/4" wood. It's not the end of the world because pocket holes are almost always hidden but it's a strange issue considering that 95% of the time you'll likely be using 3/4" for your projects. Still highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Big_T

customer_reviews.title: Yes you need one
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing. Simple and effortless to use and you can't argue with the results. I recommend having decent drill to get smoother holes. I also have a mini shop vac that fits perfectly with the attachment which allows me to keep drilling without having to clean the tool out every couple of boards.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Terrific System
customer_reviews.text: The Kreg K4 Pocket HoleJig system makes doing my woodworking projects a breeze! Straight out of the box it was very easy to set up and get started.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Brown

customer_reviews.title: Must have!!
customer_reviews.text: Completely revolutionary. I went from joining being a pain to it now be extremely enjoyable. Would highly recommend to anyone looking for an excellent pocket hole system.
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Fife

customer_reviews.title: Good but could have more diversity.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Only complaint is there isn't much difference in the angles of the guide holes. Had to get a little inventive as I was building our bed to get the angled holes I wanted in bigger pieces of wood. Quality is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Chauvot

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Very light to move around my work shop. Easy to clamp on with a 2 or 3 inch clamp. I would recommend on corners on a 4x4 3/4" or bigger to have some support on the other end to prevent a tilt or inaccurate pocket holes.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Hubby loved his gift and it worked very well
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a requested gift for my husband and he made us a bed frame using it. He loved it!
customer_reviews.author: Angie C.

customer_reviews.title: Comes in real handy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband as he borrowed his friends one time. He told me why did you buy it it cost to much!!! Ok we are remodeling the bathroom and he has used it several times and says I’m happy you bought me this!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Very good for joining boards
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for joining boards, easy to setup and to use.
customer_reviews.author: charles lawhon

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Works good. Wanted one for years and I'm glad I finally got it.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Like the tool
customer_reviews.text: Have used it for one project and it was easy to use and it did the job!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa S.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had this earlier
customer_reviews.text: Pocket holes are really easy to make with this. Worth it for any weekend woodworkers like me.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas

product_meta.title: Kreg K4 Pocket HoleJig System (K4 Jig)
product_meta.description:
Style:K4 JigThe Kreg jig® K4 is the perfect choice for do-it-yourselfers and anyone new to pocket-hole joinery. Whether you’re building your first set of garage storage shelves or making simple repairs around the house, The Kreg jig® K4 can help you finish the job in less time, and with FAR less effort than you ever thought possible. Its simple design gives you the confidence you need to get started, and you’ll have your project finished in no time with joints as easy as "drill. Drive. Done!"

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Kreg Jig is the perfect choice for DIY'ers and anyone new to pocket-screw joinery. Whether you're building your first set of garage storage shelves or making simple repairs around the house, the Kreg Jig can help you finish the job in less time and with far less effort than you ever thought possible. Its simple design gives you the confidence to start the project and with joints as easy as "Drill. Drive. Done!" You'll actually want to finish it. The Kreg Jig makes every joint you build faster and stronger, but perhaps more importantly, it makes them easier. Simple two-step operation, combined with easy thickness adjustments, built-in depth-setting-gauges, a large clamping recess and our patented 3-hole drill guide, make this the most easy-to-use Kreg Jig we've ever made. Includes everything you need to get started with pocket-screw joinery, including Kreg Jig, stepped drill bit, 6-inch square driver, dust collection shroud, starter screw set, starter plug set, skill builder DVD and quick-start guide, all inside a compact and durable carrying case.
feature_bullets: 3-Hole drill guide for pocket holes, for use with materials from 12 to 38mm thick
Removable drill guide block doubles as a repair tool; Drill Guide Spacings: 9/16", 7/8", 17/16"
Large clamping recess to secure your jig; Removable Drill Guide for benchtop and portable use
Requires no glue, no complicated math, and no small army of clamps.Clamping Method:Toggle clamp on benchtop base
Includes Kreg Jig K4, stepped drill bit, 6 inch square driver, starter Kreg Screw set, pocket-hole plug set

specifications.Included Components: Kreg Jig K4 Pocket Hole System
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars2,265 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
